titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid of the UW-Milwaukee Urban Studies Programs, 1956-2011

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, Archives Department
publicationstmt.date: Copyright © 2007 University of Wisconsin Board of Regents

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Dan Vinson

change.item: Phyllis Reske updated the finding aid to reflect minimal processing of accession 2010-065. Changes were made to the extent, abstract, scope and content, arrangement, and contents list.

Brad Houston updated the finding aid to reflect minimal processing of accession 2011-027 and to update the name of the department. Changes were made to titleproper, unittitle, extent, abstract, bioghist, and the contents list.
Hayley Jackson updated the finding aid, adding information about new, unprocessed accessions.

physdesc.label: Quantity
physdesc.extent: 6.3 cubic ft. (9 boxes and 1 flat box)

extref.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, Archives Department

did.abstract: Documents from Urban Studies Programs, formerly the Department of Urban Affairs. Included are documents relating to the establishment of the Department, meeting minutes, correspondence, program event materials, and academic planning documents, including proposals for a doctoral program and a Master of Public Administration. Much of the collection consists of records related to the Ford Foundation, which awarded the Department of Urban Affairs an early research grant. Syllabi files dating from 1981 to 2011, program reviews, and event posters are also included.

bioghist.p: The Department of Urban Affairs was established in 1963 within the College of Letters and Science. In 1965 an Urban Studies Program was established within the Department of Urban Affairs for undergraduates participating in the following majors: economics, geography, political science, and sociology. The Urban Planning program was established within the Department of Urban Affairs in Spring of 1975. The department was subsumed into Urban Studies Programs in 1987, although a separate Master of Science in Urban Affairs was still offered until 1993.

bioghist.head: Department Chairs, Department of Urban Affairs

scopecontent.p: The collection includes documents from the Urban Research Committee's proposals for the urban studies program, and an outline of a proposed 5-10 year urban studies department program. Also included are course proposals within the History Department and proposals for graduate program in urban studies. A large portion of the collection is comprised of records regarding the Ford Foundation, which awarded a research grant in December 1959.

Records of the Urban Studies Program itself include documents pertaining to the proposal for an Urban Affairs Department and for an urban studies program for undergraduates, a doctoral degree program, a joint degree program with the School of Education or the School of Information Studies, and master's of public administration program. Also included are minutes from the Department of Urban Affairs, which consist of various memos and announcements relating to courses, staffing, budgets and other departmental functions. Course syllabi, program reviews, and a flat box containing student recruitment and program event posters are also included. The collection also contains program brochures, several issues of the Intrapost, Urban Affairnewspaper, and USI News.

arrangement.p: This collection was received in, and is organized in, multiple parts. Additional materials have been physically or intellectually arranged and interfiled, and researchers may need to consult more than one part of the collection to locate similar materials.
The collection contains two additional accessions.

accessrestrict.p: NEEDS RESTRICTION STATEMENT There are no access restrictions on the materials, and the collection is open to all members of the public in accordance with state law.

userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of libel, privacy, and copyright which may be involved in the use of this collection (Wisconsin Statutes 19.21-19.39).

acqinfo.p: An unknown donor transferred the collection to the Archives prior to 1989. Accession 2010-065 was donated by an unknown donor in June 2011. The Urban Studies Program donated accession 2011-027 in December 2011.

processinfo.p: Meredith Curtis processed the collection at the Archives in April-May 1994. Thomas Steman added box four to the collection in January 1996. Hayley Jackson updated the finding aid to include information about accessions 2010-065 and 2011-027 in October 2013. Phyllis Reske updated the finding aid to include the integration of accession 2010-065.

physdesc.extent: 6.3 cubic ft. (9 boxes and 1 flat box)
